name: prefiguration
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of showing or suggesting that something will happen in the future, or an example of this: prefiguration of The painting is Cézanne's clearest prefiguration of cubism. Her films contain many echoes and prefigurations. This notion of prefiguration features prominently in his theories.
More examplesFewer examplesThe painting is remarkable for its use of symbols, in particular the cross, which is a prefiguration of Christ's Crucifixion.In a sort of prefiguration of the kind of society they wanted, they called for a "Sunday of Work" to launch the "Battle for Production".
